questions.text: The floor of a rectangular kitchen has a length six feet greater than its width `w`. Sam will increase both dimensions of the floor by three feet. Which equation represents the new area `N` of the kitchen floor?
A school purchases boxes of cookies. Each box contains 80 cookies. Each box costs $40. How much does the school have to charge for each cookie to make a profit of $15 per box?
Suppose that the equation 'D = 15.4x^2 - 572.6x + 4,750' represents the value of a motorcycle from 1972 to 2010.  What year did the motorcycle have the least value?
Sal's car ride to school is 7 minutes more than 3/5 the time of Bill's car ride. Which graph shows the possible times of Sal's and Bill's car rides?
What scenario could be represented by the graph below? (graph)
Which is the graph of the function `g(x) = 2x^2 - 4x + 12`?

Smartphone Company F charges a $20 start-up fee plus $0.15 per minute, y.  Smartphone Company G charges $0.35 per minute, y, with no start-up fee.  Which function represents the difference in cost between Company F and Company G?

Luigi compared the slope of the function graphed below to the slope of the linear function that has an x-intercept of 1/3 and a y-intercept of -3. (graph).  What is the slope of the function with the smaller slope?

The boiling point of oil, L (measured in degrees Fahrenheit), at altitude x (measured in feet) is modeled by the function L(x) = -0.026x + 572.  In terms of altitude and temperature, which statement describes the meaning of the slope?
answers: The boiling point increases by 2.6 degrees as the altitude increases by 100 feet.
The boiling point decreases by 26 degrees as the altitude increases by 100 feet.
The boiling point decreases by 2.6 degrees as the altitude increases by 100 feet.
The boiling point increases by 26 degrees as the altitude increases by 100 feet.

questions.text: A line segment has endpoints P(7,8) and Q(9,10).  The point R is the midpoint of /overlinePQ.  What is an equation of a line perpendicular to /overlinePQ and passing through R?
A triangle has vertices at (2,4), (2,-4), and (-2,-2).  What is the approximate perimeter of the triangle?
